author: iSazonov
body:
1. Add Get-Uptime into Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility.psm1
2. Add alias "uptime"
3. Correct typo
4. Add test

Close #2497

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@iSazonov**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! You've already signed the contribution license agreement. Thanks!

The agreement was validated by Microsoft and real humans are currently evaluating your PR.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@iSazonov also, I found you didn't update the unix version of `utility.psd1` (`Unix\Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility\Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility.psd1`), so is it intentional to not expose this cmdlet in Linux?
The Travis CI failed because the cmdlet is not exposed in Linux.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: 😕 What's the problem with tests? Second PR breaks down...

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
@iSazonov it's unrelated to your changes. Same story for the build from `master` https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/6.0.0-alpha.11-1017#L386

It's likely changes in `dotnet` cli. We will try to resolve it today.

comments.body: Reopened PR to build on the newer version of master (that includes a fix for new `dotnet`)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I close the PR to continue with #2517

title: Add Get-Uptime
